node.title: Samoa extends lockdown but eases some restrictions
node.description: The Samoa government has extended its Covid-19 lockdown until midnight Tuesday 3 May.

node.title: Delay in ditching MIQ system 'incredibly frustrating', returnees say
node.description: Up to 40,000 people could have skipped MIQ from November last year if the government had paid attention to top health officials.

node.title: 'Nothing else can be done': Frustrated health workers agree on strike action
node.description: Thousands of allied health workers will strike next month due to a lack of progress in lengthy pay negotiations.

node.title: Diabetes and Me: Hooked on lifting
node.description: In this week's column of Diabetes and Me, RNZ's Megan Whelan shares her journey of learning to live with type 2 diabetes and explains why the gym is now her sanctuary.

node.title: Man who killed Jacqueline Avant sentenced to 190 years to life in prison
node.description: Jacqueline Avant was shot and killed in her Beverly Hills home in December.

node.title: NZ targets Russian banks in latest sanctions over Ukraine war
node.description: Russia's largest banks and financial institutions have been targeted in New Zealand's latest round of sanctions against the country.

node.title: Grant Robertson rules out compensation over MIQ
node.description: The government is facing heavy criticism for waiting until February to ditch hotel isolation, but Acting Deputy PM Grant Robertson is ruling out compensation. Audio

node.title: Veterans Affairs Minister set to attend Anzac services in Turkey
node.description: The government will be represented at Anzac commemorations in Turkey this year - the first time since before the pandemic.

node.title: Police seek help in identifying woman found dead near Charleston
node.description: The woman was found by a member of the public on Tuesday afternoon, at the base of a bluff, near a walking track south of Constant Bay.

node.title: Justice Department will appeal mask ruling if CDC says mandate is still needed
node.description: The DOJ said Tuesday that it disagrees with a district court's decision to end the mask mandate.

node.title: China and Solomon Islands sign security pact
node.description: China's government says it has signed a framework agreement on security cooperation with Solomon Islands, adding it's not directed at any third party.

node.title: Newmarket bus lane cameras dishing out $12k in fines a day
node.description: Cameras along a 160 metre length of bus lane in Auckland's Newmarket generated $4.3 million in fines during 2021.

node.title: Bismack Biyombo is donating his $1.3M salary to build a hospital in the Congo
node.description: He said he wants to help save lives after his father died of COVID-19 last year in their home country.

node.title: Roadblock in place around residential fire in Ōtāhuhu
node.description: Emergency services are at the scene of a residential fire on Māngere Road in the Auckland suburb of Ōtāhuhu.

node.title: Teenage girl followed by man in Havelock North
node.description: Police are appealing for information after a teenage girl was followed by a man while she walked along Te Mata Road.

node.title: IAG's move into collision repair causes concern for consumers, industry
node.description: Panel beaters and painters are raising fresh concerns about an insurance giant's move into the collision repair industry, saying consumers face less transparency.

node.title: Medicinal cannabis just the beginning for Rua Bioscience
node.description: East Coast-based medicinal cannabis firm Rua Bioscience says it has plenty of other products in the works, after launching its first medicine in New Zealand.

node.title: The $29 billion plan to save Texas' coast from rising tides
node.description: The plan would be the largest infrastructure project in the nation and take up to 20 years to complete.

node.title: Biden launches $6 billion effort to save nuclear power plants
node.description: The $6 billion effort emphasizes the need to continue nuclear energy as a power source that helps to combat climate change.

node.title: Fun and Games for Birmingham aspirants
node.description: Before the serious work of preparing for Birmingham begins, a dozen Kiwi athletes have come together for fun and Games of a different kind.

node.title: Netflix stocks plunge 25% after company loses 200K subscribers
node.description: Drop stems partly from company's decision to suspend service in Russia to protest war in Ukraine, but deeper problems exist.

node.title: Two men accused of posing as federal agents indicted on federal charges
node.description: Arian Taherzadeh and Haider Ali have been indicted on false impersonation of an officer or employee of the U.S. and unlawful possession of a large capacity ammunition feeding device.

node.title: New Zealand and Singapore add climate to partnership priorities
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern and her Singaporean counterpart Lee Hsien Loong have added a focus on climate and sustainability to the enhanced relationship between the two countries.

node.title: Auckland high density housing plan 'doesn't make much sense'
node.description: Auckland Council expects a quarter of the city's character homes will lose their special heritage status when higher density rules come into force later this year.

node.title: Southland council opts to allow irrigation after water shortages
node.description: Southland farmers can turn their irrigators on again - after two weeks without them.

node.title: Police shooting rattles Taranaki community
node.description: A lifelong friend of a man shot and killed by police in Taranaki two years ago says he was shocked to hear of another fatal shooting.

node.title: Joint NZ-US solar power company launches
node.description: Helios Energy, which aims to build grid-scale solar developments, has the backing of a senior Google executive.

node.title: Floyd lawyer: Wells Fargo "killing Black homeowners opportunities"
node.description: Bank is accused of denying minorities chance to refinance their mortgages when interest rates were at record lows.

node.title: "The Flash" star Ezra Miller arrested in Hawaii for second time within weeks
node.description: Miller allegedly struck a woman on the head with a chair after being asked to leave a gathering.

node.title: Former world tennis number one set to tee off in new career
node.description: Former tennis world number one Ash Barty has added fuel to speculation that her post-retirement tennis career will focus on golf, signing up for a series of exhibition tournaments.
